content.rendered:
( Vellore & Tiruvannamalai )

Best Bank Exam Coaching Institute

Chennai IAS Academy is one the best Bank Exam Coaching Center in Vellore. They are giving best result in the bank exam.  It offers best coaching classes for ibps po & clerk, sbi po & clerk, rbi and ssc bank exams in vellore, tamil nadu. They have well experienced staffs will teach the each and every topics from the beginning level. They will provide best study material and updated daily current affairs relevant to bank exam. They are providing very good study environment to make our mind focused without any diversion.

Course Details

BANKING ADMISSION 2020 – 2021

S.NoRegular & Weekend BatchDuration & TimingsFees (Including Tax)
1SBI – PO / ClerkTill You Get Placed₹ 10,000
2IBPS – PO / ClerkTill You Get Placed₹ 10,000
3 IBPS – RRB PO/OATill You Get Placed₹ 10,000
4SSC CGL, CHSL & MTSTill You Get Placed₹ 10,000
5Special Course
(All Bank Exam & SSC)		Till You Get Placed₹ 15,000

Enquiry Form

Fill the form below. Our Student counsellor will get back to you shortly.

Course Includes

  • Study Materials
  • Foundation course (NCERT)
  • Monthly Current Affairs
  • Weekly Test

Our Highlights

  • A well-experienced faculty team
  • Guest Lectures by Officers
  • Individual Attention
  • Interview Guidance
IBPS PO & Clerk Exam
SBI PO & Clerk Exam
RBI Exam
SSC CGL, CHSL & MTS Exam

IBPS CWE PO & Clerk Examinations

Institute of Banking Personnel Selection (IBPS) conducts the IBPS CWE, PO & Clerk Exams every year. IBPS to select eligible candidates for the position of CWE, PO & Clerk in its various zones all across the country.  Chennai IAS Academy is one the Best IBPS PO & Clerk Exam Coaching Center in Vellore.

IBPS PO & Clerk will be conducted in 4 different Phases:

  • Preliminary Exam
  • Mains Exam
  • Document Verification
  • Medical Examination

he Preliminary Examination is meant to serve as a screening test only. The marks obtained in the Preliminary Examination by the applicants who are declared qualified for admission to the Main Written Examination will not be counted for determining their final order of merit.

IBPS PO & Clerk Exam Selection Process

Candidates opting for IBPS PO & Clerk Exam should know the Selection Procedure of the recruitment.  Students will be selected on the basis of the marks scored in prelims & mains stage whereas other stages will be qualifying in nature.

Age Limits:

The minimum age of the candidates must be 20 years and the maximum age limit is 28 years, to be eligible for the upcoming IBPS PO & Clerk Exams.

For SC/ST candidates: 05 Years | For OBC candidates: 03 Years.

IBPS PO & Clerk Exam Syllabus

Candidates who interested in IBPS PO & Clerk Exam can get the details of the syllabus and scheme below

IBPS PO Prelims Syllabus
 or
IBPS PO Mains Syllabus
IBPS Clerk Prelims Syllabus
 or
IBPS Clerk Prelims Syllabus

Name of the SubjectNo. of Questions Marks AllottedDuration
Reasoning Ability & Computer Aptitude506045 Minutes
English404035 Minutes

SBI PO & Clerk Examinations

State Bank of India conducts SBI PO & Clerk Exams every year to recruit candidates on the Probationary Officers & clerical position in across India. SBI select eligible candidates for the position of SBI, PO & Clerk in its various zones all across the country.  Chennai IAS Academy is one the Best SBI PO & Clerk Exam Coaching Center in Vellore..

SBI PO & Clerk will be conducted in 4 different Phases:

  • Preliminary Exam
  • Mains Exam
  • Document Verification
  • Medical Examination

Age Limits:

The lower and upper age limit indicated for post(s) in the vacancy table will be reckoned as on exam notification.
Minimum Age: 21 | Maximum Age: 30

Age Relaxation for SBI PO & Clerk Exams:

For SC/ST candidates: 05 Years | For OBC candidates: 03 Years

SBI PO & Clerk Exam Syllabus

Candidates who interested in SBI PO & Clerk Exam can get the details of the syllabus and scheme below

SBI PO Prelims Syllabus
 or
SBI PO Mains Syllabus

 or

40 Minutes

RBI Examinations

Reserve Bank of India (RBI) conducts every year to recruit candidates on the RBI Grade B position in across India. RBI selects eligible candidates for the position of Grade B in its various zones all across the country.  Chennai IAS Academy is one the Best RBI Grade  B Coaching Center in Vellore.

RBI Grade B Exam will be conducted in 3 different Phases:

  • Phase I
  • Phase II
  • Phase III - Interview

RBI Grade B Exam – Phase I (RBI – DR General)

Name of the SubjectNo. of Questions Marks Allotted
General Awareness8080
English Language3030
Quantitative Aptitude3030
Reasoning Ability6060
Total200200

RBI Grade B Exam – Phase II (RBI – DR General)

Name of the SubjectTypeMarks Duration
English Descriptive (Answers need to be typed with a keyboard)10090
Economic & Social
Issues
Objective10090
Finance & Management
Objective10090

Interview - Phase III: (RBI – DR General)

  • Candidates will be shortlisted for the interview, based on the aggregate marks obtained in Phase II.
  • The interview will be of 50 marks

Age Limits

The lower and upper age limit indicated for post(s) in the vacancy table will be reckoned as on exam notification.
Minimum Age: 21 | Maximum Age: 32

Age Relaxation for RBI Grade B Exams:

For SC/ST candidates: 05 Years | For OBC candidates: 03 Years.

RBI Grade B Exam Pattern (RBI DR – DEPR/DISM)

PhasePaperTypeMarks Duration
IEconomics/Statistics Objective100120 Minutes
IIEconomics/Statistics Descriptive 100180 Minutes
IIIEnglishDescriptive 100180 Minutes

RBI Grade B DR - DEPR/DISM Exam Selection Process

RBI Grade B DR – DEPR/DISM will be conducted in 3 different Phases:

  • Phase I
  • Phase II
  • Phase III

RBI DR - DEPR/DISM Exam Syllabus

Candidates who interested in RBI Grade B DR – DEPR/DISM Exam can get the details of the syllabus and scheme below

DR - DEPR/DISM Syllabus

1. SSC CGL Examinations

Staff Selection Commission (SSC) conducts every year to recruit candidates on the SSC CGL Group B & C position in across India. SSC selects eligible candidates for the position of Group in its various zones all across the country.  Chennai IAS Academy is one the Best SSC Coaching Center in Vellore.

SSC CGL Exam will be conducted in 4 different Phases

  • SSC CGL Tier I
  • SSC CGL Tier II
  • SSC CGL Tier III
  • SSC CGL Tier IV

SSC CGL Exam Pattern Tier I

TopicsNo. of Questions Maximum MarksTime Allocated
General Intelligence and Reasoning255060 Minutes (Total Time)
For Handicapped Candidates: 80 Minutes
General Awareness2550
Quantitative Aptitude2550
English Comprehension2550

SSC CGL Exam Pattern Tier II

TopicsNo. of Questions Maximum MarksTime Allocated
Paper I: Quantitative Abilities100200120 minutes for each paper
For Handicapped Candidates: 160 Minutes (each paper)
Paper II: English Language and Comprehension200200
Paper III: Statistics100200
Paper IV: General Studies (Finance and Economics)100200

SSC CGL Exam Pattern Tier III

Mode of ExaminationTopics Maximum MarksTime Allocated
Pen and Paper ModeDescriptive Paper in English or Hindi (Writing of Essay/ Precis/ Letter/ Application etc.) 10060 minutes for each paper
For Handicapped Candidates: 80 Minutes (each paper)

SSC CGL Exam Pattern Tier IV

Tier IV is going to be of qualifying nature, here no leniency will be given to any category candidate, if you qualify it according to the standards set then you will be selected. In this part your Data Entry Skill Test (DEST) will be taken, where your typing speed will be tested and the required criteria is 8000 key depressions per hour. Next your Computer Proficiency Test will be conducted, which is divided into three modules, that is, Word Processing, Spread Sheet and Generation of Slides, for the posts of Assistant Section Officer of CSS, Assistant Section Officer (MEA), Assistant in Serious Fraud Investigation Office (SFIO) under the Ministry of Corporate Affairs and Assistant (GSI) in the Ministry of Mines. You should have good knowledge of all these.

2. SSC CHSL Examinations

The Staff Selection Commission conducts Combined Higher Secondary Level (CHSL) exam every year for recruitment in various Ministries/ Departments/ Organizations of the Government of India.

SSC CHSL Exam Pattern

The Staff Selection Commission (SSC) starts conducting the Combined Higher Secondary Level (CHSL) in three levels for various posts:

Tier ITypeMode
Tier – IObjective Multiple ChoiceComputer Based (online)
Tier – IIDescriptive Paper in English/HindiPen and Paper mode
Tier – IIISkill Test/Computer Proficiency Test

3. SSC MTS Examination

The Staff Selection Commission (SSC) starts conducting the Combined Higher Secondary Level (CHSL) in three levels for various posts. SSC or Staff Selection Commission conducts Multi-Tasking Staff Exam (MTS) every year in 3 different stages:

  • Paper
  • Descriptive Test
  • Skill Test

Exam Pattern Paper- 2 (Descriptive Exam)

Tier ITypeMode
Tier – IObjective Multiple ChoiceComputer Based (online)
Tier – IIDescriptive Paper in English/HindiPen and Paper mode
Tier – IIISkill Test/Computer Proficiency Test
